title: Classifying Drawings with DoodleNet
description: Quick, draw! In this video, I demonstrate how to use the DoodleNet pre-trained machine learning model to classify drawings of cats, strawberries, and other common doodles in JavaScript (with p5.js and ml5.js).

codeExamples.title: Starting Template
codeExamples.description: This sketch creates a doodling canvas.

codeExamples.title: Mouse
codeExamples.description: This sketch classifies doodles created with a mouse.

codeExamples.title: Video
codeExamples.description: This sketch classifies images from a webcam.

links.title: Quick, Draw! The Data
links.description: Google webpage with Quick Draw dataset with over 50 millions drawings.

links.title: DoodleNet Repository (GitHub)
links.description: Yining Shi's repository with experiments about the Doodle Classifier.

links.title: Quick, Draw! - Coding Challenge #122
links.description: In this coding challenge, I take a closer look at the Quick, Draw! dataset and create a simple node API to "replay" drawings of rainbows and cats using p5.js.

links.title: Shape Classifier with ml5.js - Coding Challenge #158
links.description: In this challenge, I demonstrate the entire process of training and deploying a machine learning classification model in JavaScript -- data collection, model training, and prediction!
